channel.title: Peer To Peer Chat experiment
channel.description:
i wanted to learn about some kind of peer-to-peer-model, so a made a peertopeerchat program,
I'm done with it, so here you go, do what you want with it, later, ill make a peer-to-peer version of my old program PaintPad, that will be win,
the packets are formatted in xml, using the JDOM library,
any packets received are simply forwarded to everyone, that way everyone see it, its not a very secure way, i can think of at least 5 or 6 methods of attacking this network,
i also used the one-jar package so you dont have to lag the jdom.jar library all the time,
iv been working on this since december 2007, save for my exams and stuff, it took me a long time, and now im fairly sure its bug-free
before i released this, i tried to stir up some people to help me test it, i only managed to get two people on it, but oh well, heres a screenshot anyway
[URL=http://img169.imageshack.us/img169/5093/p2pscreenshotdy7.png][IMG]http://img169.imageshack.us/img169/5093/p2pscreenshotdy7.th.png[/img][/URL]
for more details, read the readme.txt which is a massive wall of text, containing far too much detail,

item.title: Peer To Peer Chat experiment
item.dc:creator: @pizza_pie pizza pie
item.description:
@pizza_pie wrote:

[quote=“yakman, post:14, topic:213314”][quote author=pizza pie link=topic=280796.msg2283111#msg2283111 date=1213781221]
Also, when I put the host IP as 0.0.0.0 and clicked “Connect” it kept connecting over and over and over and over and over and over and over… buggage
[/quote]

i tried that and i get nothing, it just says "ConnectException, failed to connect to 0.0.0.0:47654
describe what you saw[/quote]

Lol, nevermind. It went away somehow. But last time it kept saying “Alex has joined” or w/e it says, it just kept going until I exited out. I don’t think it will be a problem.

Read full topic

item.title: Peer To Peer Chat experiment
item.dc:creator: @BAsh BAsh
item.description:
@BAsh wrote:

It looks good yakman. I was thinking about something like this but never really thought about the implementation. Could be useful as a distribution network for an updated rs.jar. Not that I would ever have the time to implement that either.

Read full topic

item.title: Peer To Peer Chat experiment
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

pizza pie:

Also, when I put the host IP as 0.0.0.0 and clicked “Connect” it kept connecting over and over and over and over and over and over and over… buggage

i tried that and i get nothing, it just says "ConnectException, failed to connect to 0.0.0.0:47654
describe what you saw,

as for assertions,
i really dont use them for the normal purposes, (i never need to check my assumsions, they are always correct :P)
i like to make my source code readable, and sometimes when iv made an assumsion, it might not be clear to the reader,
like there are places when i deliberatly didnt check for null, because of the assumsion that the queue wasnt empty,
i could just comment it “//not checking for null here cause i know the queue is not empty”
but i use assert instead, just put “assert packet != null;” and it serves the same purpose,

[quote=“la­wl, post:4, topic:213314”][quote author=Frell link=topic=280796.msg2282540#msg2282540 date=1213758343]

…[/quote]

Allocation tool. However i may be wrong.[/quote]

that made me lol,
and look at him editing his post to try to cover it up

Read full topic

item.title: Peer To Peer Chat experiment
item.dc:creator: @pizza_pie pizza pie
item.description:
@pizza_pie wrote:

Hmm… It’s nice, thanks for sharing with us, I just noticed a lot of fun stuff you can do with this

Also, when I put the host IP as 0.0.0.0 and clicked “Connect” it kept connecting over and over and over and over and over and over and over… buggage

Read full topic

item.title: Peer To Peer Chat experiment
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

Avalanche:

Could a peer to peer concept be used for making a game?

yes, but without a server it would be impossible to know if someone is cheating
and, when one person disconnects from another, all the clients they had will disconnect as well, so its not reliable

Read full topic

item.title: Peer To Peer Chat experiment
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

[quote=“io9, post:10, topic:213314”]Java has assertion?! Why was I not told of this?![/quote]because it is largely useless

[quote=“Frell, post:8, topic:213314”][quote author=Cheese_Police link=topic=280796.msg2282739#msg2282739 date=1213765326]

Oh, looks nice. One question, may sound stupid, but here’s it anyway: What’s an assert? O_o [quote] assert var != null[/quote]

Allocation tool. However i may be wrong.

Rule 2:
We don’t talk about things we don’t know.

I used google, there might be something else that has java asset in it but i don’t know. Every search result said java asset locator, allocation, and other things that had nothing to do with it.

Edit: ohhhh asse[size=15pt]R[/size]t. lol.

fucking idiot go die
[/quote]
I don’t see you attempting to help anyone.[/quote]you dont know what the fuck you are talking about, dont post

Read full topic

item.title: Peer To Peer Chat experiment
item.dc:creator: @BAsh BAsh
item.description:
@BAsh wrote:

Assert is basically equivalent to this:

if (JVM_DEBUG_ON && (var != null)) throw new AssertionError();

Where JVM_DEBUG_ON is a variable set by the vm when it starts up. It allows you to have an error message as well by putting text after the ‘:’.

Read full topic
